Camera Site Description: Open mixed conifer/aspen forest. Abundant black spruce. Understory of moss and roses. Lots of downed woody debris
Comments and Access Notes: Drove in along small road/cutline (?) through cell LU2-33 north of main road. Parked where the road forks, then walked northeast along road/cutline/game trails to GPS point.

Camera Site Description: Camera positioned along a defined game trail beside beautiful pond. Bring binos for ducks! Sapling in front of camera lured - be careful!
Comments and Access Notes: Follow an old ATV trail (fairly overgrown) from E side of road. Follow until you reach a lot of downed trees and take a left into the forest.

Camera Site Description: Open spruce & aspen forest, next to a river. Some low shrubs, horsetails, moss. Slight game trails along the side of the river. Moose scat by camera.
Comments and Access Notes: Off grid replacement. Took imperial mills loop road, parked & walked in on cutline. Easy walk.

Camera Site Description: Mixed wood forest with semi-open understory. Near very dense patch of conifer.
Comments and Access Notes: Parked on side of road, near where the cutline shows up on map. Walked E into forest.

Camera Site Description: At the end of a dead end road by CP rail. ~100m from rail. Stand of conifers next to aspen/mixed wood. Open understory. Fence w/ game trail where animals jumping over. Pointing down trail and junction.
Comments and Access Notes: Drive to end of road by dead end sign/CP rail. Walk into forest towards conifers. Deer bones/antler found in area. Also found an empty Bushnell trail cam on forest floor. Near kill site. Scat maybe wolf.

Camera Site Description: Semi-open stand of spruce. Mossy forest floor w/ horsetails & labrador tea. Network of game trails throughout. Camera pointing @ junction of 2 trails.
Comments and Access Notes: Parked on side of road, walked into forest. Fairly easy access. Lots of ungulate scat on trail.

Camera Site Description: Lowland boggy area w/ black spruce & larch. Followed a nice distinct game trail in. Lots of labrador tea. Some kind of scat in front of camera.
Moderately dense spruce & aspen stand, on a game trail right next to a small creek. Horsetail & short shrubs. Looks like a forestry araea flagged off nearby.

Sparsely treed, dry forest. Black spruce forest. Mossy understory, some labrador tea. Beautiful game trails, multiple trails forming a network through forest stand. Camera where one game trail diverges into two. Locked with OSM A2 key.
Comments and Access Notes: Parked near offshoot road along main road leading to Lakeland PRA, near tree with a silver triangle attached, close to camera site if walking straight to GPS point from main road. Followed cutline on north sde of road west until terrain drops down to bog, then walked north along distinct game trails to camera. Locked with OSM A2 key.

Camera Site Description: Mixed wood stand. Semi-open understory w/ some shrubs. Many game trails throughout.
Comments and Access Notes: Parked on side of road near clear cut line. Followed cutline N into forest and then picked up game trail going west.

Camera Site Description: In mixed wood forest, low density canopy. Horsetails and low shrubs on forest floor. Camera pointing at junction of two game trails.
Comments and Access Notes: Parked by where the old road would have extended into site 43. Walked along old cutline and then dipped into forest.

Camera Site Description: On game trail in older growth conifer pocket surrounded by young alder.
Comments and Access Notes: Follow open grass cutline on the border of centroids 15 and 13 W-bound. Follow game trail N-bound when in line w/ camera location waypoint.

Camera Site Description: Open, dry upland stretch, white spruce & larhe aspen, shrubby understory (sasparitta, rose, etc.) Lots of berries! 2 intersecting game trails in front of camera
Comments and Access Notes: Drove down the road south of Heart Lake, went through Heart Lake FN checkpoint. Can only drive in just past cell 50. Site accesed off side of a cutline. Replacement for 53 between 51 and 50.

Camera Site Description: Open aspen stand w/ sparse white spruce, tall grass & some shrubs. Old cutblocks nearby. Camera on game trail (scat seen on trail) in some conifers where grass grew a bit shorter.
Comments and Access Notes: Replacing site 55 - could not access. Parked along resource road S of Heart Lake and walked in through shrubby open area.

Camera Site Description: Moderately dense black spruce forest adjacent to grassy, boggy clearing. Well defined game trail network. Camera at cross-section of two distinct game trails. Understory of moss, gross, and roses.
Comments and Access Notes: Parked along main road then walked through grassy clearing on south side of road (visible from main road). Followed game trails south through clearing, then turned west towards camera.

Camera Site Description: Lowland black spruce forest with understory of moss and labrador tea. Lots of networks of game trails. Camera pointed at convergence of two trails into one. Moderately dense forest.
Comments and Access Notes: Parked on road closest camera then just walked straight in along game trails to GPS point. Wolf & possibly lynx tracks observed by road where we parked.

Camera Site Description: Open aspen stand w/ some spruce, tall shrubs (gooseberry, rose, sasporilla), faint game trails throughout, easy walking through. Deer scat seen on way in.
Comments and Access Notes: Easy - parked & walked in.

Camera Site Description: Aspen forest right at the boundary of low-wetland/tamarack area. Distinct game trail. Following the boundary of habitats. Camera pointing downtrail at an angle. Semi-open understory with forage.
Comments and Access Notes: Park on side of road near cutline. Game trail going between the upland/aspen & lowland/tamarack stand. Moose scat in area. Shepherdia bushes in area.

Camera Site Description: Aspen/black spruce stand, downslope from a road near some boggy areas. Understory of rose, sasparilla and corn. Can. (dogwood?) flowers. Poorly defined game trail.
Comments and Access Notes: Parked after first junction in road (off highway from north) and before second pond on the right (when driving in). Walked ~1.8km down cutlines/roads towards site, then walked ~80m downslope towards camera site.

Camera Site Description: In conferious forest w/ moss understory. Camera facing game trail right before a small creek. At bottom of ridge.
Comments and Access Notes: On game trail off of cutline that starts roadside on E-side of road. Game trail runs parallel to cutline for ~20m then connects back. 2 x kestrel at site.

Camera Site Description: Dry upland forest, mixed spruce and large aspens, variably open canopy, some downed woody debris. Understory of grasses and rose. Lots of deer scat and tracks along game trail. Converging of two trails.
Comments and Access Notes: Parked along main road then walked in directly to GPS point.

Camera Site Description: Game trail in coniferous forest. Moss understory. One aspen near camera.
Comments and Access Notes: Look for start of pipeline (there are small signs) on S-side of road. Follow in until you reach a game trail.

Camera Site Description: Moderately dense black spruce forest. Mossy understory with moderate amount of downed woody debris. Camera on covergence of two game trails. Forest adjacent to stream and wetland (upslope from stream) and adjacent to open aspen forest w/ grassy understory.
Comments and Access Notes: Parked on main road west of wetland with 4 white markers on raod. Walked in south on west side of wetland then crossed where stream narrowed to access mossy conifer forest visible on east side of stream. Then followed game trails to site. Can also walk along creek bed if dry enough.

Camera Site Description: Mixed wood patch in aspen stand. Camera facing meeting point of 2 game trails.
Comments and Access Notes: Be sure to trim back green up at servicing. Bushwhack from road, N-side. No best way.

Camera Site Description: Along game trail in coniferous forest w/ moss understory. Lots of deadfall but a prominent clear game trail.
Comments and Access Notes: Park roadside and bushwack on S-side of road to camera site.

Camera Site Description: Black spruce forest, large trees with diverse understory. Some aspens. Lots of downed woody debris. Looks like a mature forest. Lre on a small conifer.
Comments and Access Notes: Parked at cutline on trail with signs/billboard just before the Lakeland PRA campsite. Big pullout across from cutline entrance. Followed cutline, then bushwhacked down game trail to camera site. ATV tracks on trail with "AB Parks wildlife camera project" sign at trailhead on main road.

Camera Site Description: On game trail in coniferous forest (sparsely spaced) w/ mossy understory surrounded by poplar forest w/ grass understory.
Comments and Access Notes: Bushwhack from N-side of road to camera location

Camera Site Description: Mixed wood stand of spruce & aspen. Mossy floor with minimal shrubs
Comments and Access Notes: Park on side of road. Follow game trail E into forest.

Camera Site Description: Camera in small shaded/treed section within tall grass clearing. Game trail leads through grass in front of camera. Deciduous forest of aspens. Damp understory of aspens and grasses.
Comments and Access Notes: Parked at pullout just before cell towers on road past Lakeland PRA. Walked down cutline until path to camera site is perpendicular to cutline then walked straight to site through mostly tall grass. Placed woody debris on grass in front of camera to supress growth/vegetation triggers. "Hella tracks ground here" - LKE.

Camera Site Description: Edge of aspen stand next to large boggy open area w/ creek running through it. Signs of beaver. Camera pointing at junction of two trails.
Comments and Access Notes: Park on side of road right by open area w/ creek flowing through. Obvious game trail skirting along side forest/bog edge going S. Area needs lots of landscaping. Check crews to trim back any shrubs growing up in camera field of view. Also note very large aspen snag that might fall - caution. Deer snag.

Camera Site Description: Stand of coniferous forest next to early growth aspens. Very clean and distinct game trail. Camera pointing across trail with a minor trail at junction.
Comments and Access Notes: Park on the side of road where stand of coniferous trees are. Follow game trail S into grid cell.

Camera Site Description: Primarily aspen forest mixed with few black spruce, dense understory of aspen and grasses. Lots of fallen large aspens. Adjacent to large wetland to the west of GPS point.
Comments and Access Notes: Parked on main road then walked directly in towards camera site.

Camera Site Description: High density aspen/mixed wood forest. Very shrubby & grassy understory - difficult to find a game trail in an open area. Some deer scat in area.
Comments and Access Notes: Parked on the side of road & hiked into forest. Parked at boundary of cell 42 and 18. Did a lot of landscaping at site. Crews doing camera checks should cut down any shrubs/aspen seedlings that might grow in front of camera.

Camera Site Description: Spruce forest w/ mossy understory & labrador tea. Adjacent to open area w/ young aspens growing. Camera is pointing at junction of two well-defined trails. Half-fallen tree may be in field of view. Weasel runway?
Comments and Access Notes: Parked on side of road & walked ~NW along open stretch before cutting W into stand of conifers and picking up a very well-defined game trail in the moss ~220m from road. Deer scat observed on trail.

Camera Site Description: Open forest, spruce & aspen, not a ton of understory, rose & club moss & horsetail. Creek-ish nearby.
Comments and Access Notes: Drove in on road south of Heart Lake (had to pass through Heart Lake FN checkpoint). Parked on old road (private road sign totally gorown in old forestry road), walked in just past wetland & followed game trails in. Nice area! Locked with 122 code.

Camera Site Description: Dry wood upland spruce/aspen forest. Understory sparse with lots of decaying leaves, some roses. Abundant downed woody debris.
Comments and Access Notes: Parked along main road then walked directly in along cutline, then turned right towards GPS point.

Camera Site Description: On game trail in sparsely spaced mixed wood stand dominated by aspen w/ short in height understory. Camera on paper birch.
Comments and Access Notes: Park on forestry road and follow game trails from W-side of road to camera site.

Camera Site Description: In conifer pocket in aspen forest w/ shorter understory. On game trail.
Comments and Access Notes: 2021: accessed through First Nation's land. Park truck at most safe spot and walk down road into cell 51 (might be able to park beside "cell booster" building if enough trees on road are cleared). Access game trail on W side of road and follow to camera. **Might be able to access from S-access in 2022. NOTE: weird makeup and ring light on the road.

Camera Site Description: On a game trail through coniferous stand w/ mossy understory. Lots of fresh deadfall and many older game trails in area.
Comments and Access Notes: Access on E-side of road. No best way to bushwack or follow game trails to camera.

Camera Site Description: Open, mature white spruce & aspen stand, large tall trees. Shorter shrubby understory. Faint game trails in stand. Old cutblocks in area, older logging roads. Saw white-tailed deer on way in.
Comments and Access Notes: Accessed off resource road S of Heart Lake. Parked at offshoot road (very grown in - walked in on road) & followed game trail into a mature stand.

Camera Site Description: Along game trail in open stand of mixed wood (paper birch and confiers). Minimal understory.
Comments and Access Notes: Park on W-side of road and bushwack to camera site. Near "cutline" on map but it only exists on E-side of road.

Camera Site Description: Open, mature white spruce & aspen stand, tall trees & tall shrubby understory. Lots of deadfall. Some light game trails snaking through area. Fresh wolf (?) scat on road.
Comments and Access Notes: Drove all the way down resource road south of Heart Lake, til treefall blocked road. Walked ~1.3km down road & followed game trial into spruce aspen stand.

Camera Site Description: Patch of conifer forest adjacent to large open grass meadow (clear cut?). Lots of deadfall, hard to find any distinct game trails in area.
Comments and Access Notes: Parked next to road by open field. Walked at edge of field & forest & entered forest W. Some deer scat in area.

Camera Site Description: Dry black sspruce/pine stand, lichen & rose understory. In stand next to a powerline & pipeline, lots of cutlines; quiet area, ungulate tracks
Comments and Access Notes: Road to site is closed (winter road?). Walked in 1/2km down road and turned down cutline (pipeline?) - site is off of powerline.

Camera Site Description: Black spruce bog, open & mossy, labrador tea understory, faint game trails throughout, fewer cutlines. Camera on intersection of 2 game trails. Not a ton of tracks but still ungulate tracks around.
Comments and Access Notes: Parked on side of offshoot road from main road & walked in along a cutline. Camera seems to be bad at taking photos (note 08/2021 from data entry: possibly due to extreme heat during deployment).

Camera Site Description: On game trail coming into forest from wide legacy line (~50m). Camera facing into forest.
Comments and Access Notes: Park just before junction of forestry road w/ cold lake weapons range gate. Head into forest on W-side of road or follow legacy line edge.

Camera Site Description: Upland forest w/ lots of 3D seismic line grids.
Comments and Access Notes: Park on side of road, walk into forest - follow 3D seismic lines. Ungulate scat - possibly caribou?

Camera Site Description: On game trail off of old cutline (some scat on line).
Comments and Access Notes: Pull into pull out on S-side of road. Bushwhack through forest to overgrown cutline. Follow to camera.

Camera Site Description: Open older pine stand w/ large trees, aspens & labrador tea understory. Upland hill-ish area. Nice defined game trails. Noisy transfer station nearby. Deer tracks in area. Locked with A2 Key.
Comments and Access Notes: Drove up dirt road & parked where a tree fell across road; walked another ~100m toward transfer station & turned in to walk up a game trail. Easy walking. Don't drive road it it is raining. Used OSM A2 key.

Camera Site Description: On cutline in slightly marshy setion. Facing towards a potential cross road of trails. Note: did not update camera label to LU3-126
Comments and Access Notes: Drove east to the end of the road from the Cenovus camp. Then south towards LU3-126. Road ends at processing site/well pad(?) Hiked into forest near the office and picked up a cut line going EW. 1. When on cutline after 1-2m, had NW. Bush loos thick but open up & you avoid bog. 2. Camera set up on cutline ~200m east of the end of the road.

Camera Site Description: Camera facing convergence of two well-defined game trails in mossy understory
Comments and Access Notes: Drive to SW edge of well pad (enter W). Walk ~200m through forest you will come to an open grass patch w/ shrubs. Follow game trail through grass to aspen stand. Through wall of aspen is sparsely spaced confierous trees.

Camera Site Description: Black spruce stand at edge of aspen stand, mossy understory w/ labrador tea, birch shrubs, horsetail. Followed a game trail in off an old cutline. Lots of large cutlines in area. Lots of moose scat and some deer(?) scat in area. Locked with A1 lock.
Comments and Access Notes: Parked at gravel pit (road has a knocked over barricade). Walked in on old road-ish feature on west side of pit ()may have to walk around large pile to find it). Lots of human junk & some camping sign in area. Followed a cutline off old road then followed a game trail in to site. Locked with A1 lock (OSM A1 key).

Camera Site Description: on 3D seismic line. Moss understory. Upland w/ some lowland on access.
Comments and Access Notes: Park roadside as close as possible. Follow seismic lines to GPS location.

Camera Site Description: Open pine forest w/ thin trees at an edge transitioning into a wetter black spruce stand. Minimal understory w/ lichen. Deer scat in front of camera + followed deer into area. Camera on a couple intersecting game trails.
Comments and Access Notes: Parked on side of south Kirby plant road, easy walk in. Site used to replace inaccessible cell (37).

Camera Site Description: On a cut line in an area surrounded by bog lan
Comments and Access Notes: Pulled into small truck trail on the west side of the highway. Followed cut lines going east away from hwy. ~200m from hwy.

Camera Site Description: Amongst sparse coniferous trees behind aspen stand. Camera facing game trail w/ lured shrub.
Comments and Access Notes: Pull off main road on W side at a reclamation pond. Follow game trail through aspen stand to camera location.

Camera Site Description: Camera facing cutline. Upland. Lured downed tree right in front of camera, proceed with caution!
Comments and Access Notes: Pull over roadside near clear cutline on S side of road. Follow cutline for ~200m. Camera on W-side of cutline. NOTE: need to get Cenovus contact to open emergency egress gates - there are TWO of them (can't see the second one from the first).

Camera Site Description: On old cutline among confiers, moss/lichen understory. Upland.
Comments and Access Notes: Park as close as possible on road. Access via W-side of road, across grass across powerline and into forest on old cutline w/ some deadfall

Camera Site Description: Boggy area, skinny pines & larches, lots of deadfall. Minimal wildlife sign. Camera placed on faint game trail. Lots of labrador tea & moss. Access road looks like issued for ATVing.
Comments and Access Notes: Access road is fenced off, ATV use only. Walked in on road. Camera is justy outisde cell, inside cell is mostly bog with small trees, couldn't find good place to put camera.

Camera Site Description: Junction of two cutlines through larch-dominated bog. BEAUTIFUL. Trees are sparse. Wet but little pooling/standing water.
Comments and Access Notes: Walked from well pad to site down cutline starting at "sub-soil pile". Parked at far end of well pad closest to GPS point. Saw a caribou on closest well pad. Forgot to add user label in camera.

Camera Site Description: Area behind a reflection pond that is very cutline-dense. Black spruce & pine dominant. Lots of ungulate tracks, some scat. Camera on smaller cutline intersecting w/ game trail.
Comments and Access Notes: Parked in pullout around the bottom center of grid cell 20. Walked under pipeline & around pond, enter on obvious cutline. Forgot to add user label in camera

Camera Site Description: Camera aimed at wide (6m) cutline. Dry, mossy understory. Dense black spruce stand. Well-defined game trail along the cutline.
Comments and Access Notes: Parked by small building on short off-shoot road from a main road then walked in along obvious cutline on the bend of the short road near building

Camera Site Description: Well-defined game trail along ridge. Understory of rose and lichen. Loud, active well site nearby. Relatively large black spruce trees, moderately dense.
Comments and Access Notes: Parked on shoulder of road sout of offshoot road to nearest well site (north of camera). Walked along cutline perpendicular to main road, leading towards lake.

Camera Site Description: Open jackpine forest at edge of some aspens/alder. Slight slope w/ mossy & open understory. Close to road (~50m).
Comments and Access Notes: Park on side of road. Walk into jackpine forest (N).

Camera Site Description: Stand of confiers close to some aspen stands. Burrow ~15m down the trail?
Comments and Access Notes: Parked just after bend in road, on the side.  Hiked along cut line (dry) and picked up game trail going into forest.

Camera Site Description: In sparse forest w/ mossy understory facing well-defined game trail
Comments and Access Notes: Take gravel road on E side of hwy 881 till just before gravel pit.  Camera is on S-side of road. Easy access through any part of forest.

Camera Site Description: Primarily deciduous forest with large aspens and shorter spruce. Camera on poorly defined game trail with dense understory of grasses and aspen. Low canopy cover.
Comments and Access Notes: Parked on side of road just outside of the CNRL security gate, then walked directly in towards site.

Camera Site Description: Black spruce stand, open area w/2 intersecting game trails (not very distinct), lots of labrador tea. Some ungulate trails
Comments and Access Notes: Parked on road side & followed some trails in. Camera placed on edge of cell to avoid being close to a JEM site.

Camera Site Description: Mixed aspen and spruce stand surrounded by well sites and clearcutes. Camera on poorly defined game trail. Understory of aspens, but mostly leafy debris. Lots of downed woody debris.
Comments and Access Notes: Parked on nearest well site then walked east to forest stand. Accessed by following road straight after entering CNRL security gate. Fresh scat on trail directly in front of camera.

Camera Site Description: Wet, boggy area. Camera put in single patch of tamarack, area outside otherwise fairly treeless/has fairly short trees. Mossy understory with lots of bog plants. Very faint game trail on a cutline.
Comments and Access Notes: Enter CNRL Kirby gate, drive to last well pad & park to walk in. Camera just outside of cell because few spots for cameras. + have to move some other sites. Note: lock won't unlock - might need bolt cutters to remove.

Camera Site Description: Grassy upland, dried bog surrounded by forest dominated by mixed aspen and spruce. Understory of rose and horsetails. Forest stand is surrounded by clear cuts.
Comments and Access Notes: Parked at nearest well site, north of camera site. Walked west along cutline, southhwest of well site, then turned to enter huge cutblock to the south. Walked through cutblock to camera. Disturbed wasp nest and nearly got attacked, then sat on roses. Evil site based on longitude. Little animal sign, only poorly defined game trail

Camera Site Description: Camera in slightly open area - dry and mossy; stand of pine and spruce.
Comments and Access Notes: Parked on side of road and hiked in ~100m.

Camera Site Description: Cutline adjacent heading to clearing. Forest dominated by black spruce. Fairly dry with mossy understory. Well-defined game trail.
Comments and Access Notes: Parked on road leading to Jackfish 3 plant. Walked in along cutline about 45 degree angle with the road, leading towards Jackfish plant. Following cutline to clearing w/ tall grass, then turn right. MOSQUITOS!

Camera Site Description: Open, older black spruce forest - tall trees. Lots of aspen & labrador tea, mossy understory. Faint game trails through area. Bear scat seen on walk in.
Comments and Access Notes: Parked on roadside, walked into site along cutline.

Camera Site Description: Dry sandy clearing with small, dense jack pine stands. Camera is above clearing with signs of random camping, about 30m away. Camera is on medium sized jackpine. Locked with A1 lock.
Comments and Access Notes: Drove down obvious cutline just west of main Jackfish plant access road. Walked north past pond/beaver dam into clearing. Locked with OSM A1 lock.

Camera Site Description: Intersection of old cutline and diverging game trail. Aimed at 2 game trails diverging from one. Mixed aspen and black spruce forest. Labrador tea understory.
Comments and Access Notes: Parked on shoulder of main Jackfish road and walked straight in towards site; use main cutlines to walk along.

Camera Site Description: Habitat edge between open meadow/shrubs and conifer forest.
Comments and Access Notes: Parked on side of road, walked E towards aspens/open meadow. Cutline running N-S at the center of open meadow w/ a solar panel.

Camera Site Description: Open pine & aspen forest, taller trees, minimal understory. Game trail on old cutline. RT hawk in area that circled and hawked at us for ~10 mins.
Comments and Access Notes: Parked at an oil pad off Cenovus roads (need to go through Cenovus gates). Don't actually park on or walk through the well pad. Walked in on an older road to the right of the well pad. Camera seems to have an issue with detections - was not taking many photos on set up - subject needs to be fairly close. (note 08/2021 from data entry: possibly due to extreme heat during deployment).

Camera Site Description: Young aspen stand w/ lots of deadfall along old cutline. Located on an aspen facing deadfall that is lured.
Comments and Access Notes: Off hwy 881 onto industry road, pulled into old gravel pit w/ gate to park. Walk to the NE corner of pit and follow cutlines to camera. Large ungulate tracks in area.
